stories.text:
Hello HN, I am the CTO at a telemedicine startup and we have been building a great platform and operation model, but almost all the knowledge is in our heads so we usually need someone to explain how something work to every new employee.

We have tried multiple tools for knowledge base but the adoption inside the company is very poor.

Do you have any advice on how to promote knowledge sharing and documentation via written tools?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to adopt writing culture in my startup?
I Think I Know Why You Can't Hire Engineers Right Now
Human receives heart from gene-edited pig

stories.text:
Hi! I've had a few programming jobs over the last 2/3 years(mostly at startups, and also for one Fortune 500 company as a contractor), and I really struggle mentally, I can't take the pressure of most regular programming jobs, the deadlines, the meetings, the hierarchy, the constant need to stay on top of new tech, it's really burning me out.

I'm looking for something less stressful/demanding, but still in tech. I'm OK with earning less, do you have any idea of what kind of jobs I could look for? Thanks
stories.title: Ask HN: What's the easiest/lowest pressure tech job you know of?
